0.title: Medicaid; delete repealer on statute that establishes Division of Medicaid.
0.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Automatic Repealer On The Statute Which Establishes The Division Of Medicaid; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Statute That Provides Health Care Services Covered Under The Medicaid Program; To Delete The Freeze On Nursing Facility Reimbursement Rates; To Amend Section 43-13-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Transportation Program For Recipients Receiving Necessary Dialysis Services; To Amend Section 43-13-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealers On The Annual Assessment On Licensed Hospitals In Mississippi To Provide Funding For The Medicaid Program, On Administrative Provisions Relating To The Hospital Assessment, And On The Payment Of Additional Annual Medicare Upper Payment Limits And Disproportionate Share Hospital Payments To Mississippi Hospitals That Participate In The Medicaid Program; And For Related Purposes.

1.title: Appropriation; Division of Medicaid.
1.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Governor's Office-division Of Medicaid For The Purpose Of Providing Medical Assistance Under The Mississippi Medicaid Law And Defraying The Expenses Of The Administration Of That Law For The Fiscal Year 2014.

2.title: Herman Gray; commend life and legacy of upon his passing.
2.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Mr. Herman Gray And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

3.title: Dustin Hunter Renfroe; commend athletic success and congratulate upon being selected in the 2013 MLB Draft.
3.description: A Resolution Commending The Athletic Success Of Dustin Hunter Renfroe Of The Mississippi State Bulldogs Baseball Team And Congratulating Him Upon Being Selected In The First Round Of The Major League Baseball Draft As The 13th Selection.

4.title: Mrs. Julia Maxine Yarber Russell; commend life and legacy upon her passing.
4.description: A Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Service Of Mrs. Julia Maxine Yarber Russell And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

5.title: St. Andrew's Episcopal School; commend upon being selected as one of top private day schools in the nation.
5.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating St. Andrew's Episcopal School Upon Being Selected As One Of The Top Private Schools In The Nation.

6.title: Madison Central High School; commend and congratulate upon winning JV Division of 2013 Academic Competition National Championship.
6.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Madison Central High School Trivia Team For Winning The National Championship Of The 2013 Academic Competition Jv Division.

7.title: Sylvarena Baptist Church; commend on special occasion of its 115th anniversary.
7.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Sylvarena Baptist Church Upon The 115th Year Anniversary Of Its Founding.

8.title: MSU Bulldogs Baseball Team; commend and congratulate on a remarkable season and College World Series appearance.
8.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Mississippi State Bulldogs Baseball Team Upon A Remarkable Season And For Reaching The Finals In The 2013 College Baseball World Series.

9.title: Bishop Ronnie C. Crudup, Sr.; commend on occasion of 35 years of gospel ministry and excellent spiritual leadership.
9.description: A Resolution Commending Bishop Ronnie C. Crudup, Sr., For His Twenty-six Years Of Dedicated Service, Spiritual Leadership And Ecclesiastical Excellence As Pastor Of New Horizon Church International, His Thirty-five Years In Gospel Ministry And Congratulating Him On The Occasion Of His 60th Birthday.

10.title: International Musicians Day; recognize in Mississippi.
10.description: A Resolution Expressing The Desire Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives To Establish International Musicians Day In Mississippi With The Goal Of Establishing The Celebration Worldwide And Extending The Appreciation Of The Legislature To All Mississippi Musicians.

11.title: Mrs. Tallie Mae Cannon Jackson; commemorate life and express sympathy upon her passing.
11.description: A Resolution Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Mrs. Tallie Mae Cannon Jackson And Expressing Sympathy Upon Her Passing.

12.title: Reverend Julius H. Bass, Sr.; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
12.description: A Resolution Commending The Service, Life And Legacy Of Reverend Julius Howell Bass, Sr., And Extending Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

13.title: Methodist Children's Homes; acknowledge and commend services as a foster care and group home program.
13.description: A Resolution Acknowledging And Commending The Exceptional Services Provided By The Methodist Children's Homes To Promote Foster Care And Provide A Wholesome Family Setting For Displaced, Abused And Neglected Children.

14.title: MS State Bulldogs Baseball Team; congratulate for phenomenal season and amazing college world series appearance.
14.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Mississippi State Bulldogs Baseball Team Upon A Phenomenal Season And For Progressing To The Finals In The 2013 College Baseball World Series.

15.title: Mayor Andre' DeBerry; commend for many years of service as Mayor of Holly Springs.
15.description: A Resolution Commending Mayor Andre' Deberry On His Many Years Of Service As Mayor Of Holly Springs, Mississippi.

16.title: ECCC Warrior Baseball Team; commend and congratulate on winning the 2013 MACJC State Championship.
16.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The East Central Community College Warrior Baseball Team For Their Outstanding 2013 Season And For Winning The Mississippi Association Of Community And Junior Colleges State Championship.

17.title: First Baptist Church of Hickory Flat; commend and congratulate upon the celebration of its 125th year anniversary.
17.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating First Baptist Church Of Hickory Flat Upon The 125th Year Anniversary Of Its Founding.

18.title: Mrs. Leola McCaskill Lymon; commend life and legacy of upon her passing.
18.description: A Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Service Of Mrs. Leola Mccaskill Lymon And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

19.title: Camille Scales Young; commend upon selection as the first African-American President of the MSU Nat'l Alumni Association.
19.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mrs. Camille Scales Young Upon Being Selected The First African-american Female President Of The Mississippi State University National Alumni Association.

20.title: Mrs. Frances Heidel; commend for distinguished years of service with the Mississippi House of Representatives.
20.description: A Resolution Commending Mrs. Frances Heidel For Her Distinguished Service With The Mississippi House Of Representatives, Congratulating Her Upon Retirement And Wishing Her Many Years Of Enjoyment During Her Retirement.

21.title: Director Randy Hendrix; Mississippi Department of Mental Health mourn the loss of.
21.description: A Resolution Mourning The Loss Of Dr. Albert Randel (randy) Hendrix, Former Executive Director Of The Mississippi Department Of Mental Health, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

22.title: Representative Kelvin O. Buck; commend for legislative service and congratulate upon being elected Mayor of Holly Springs.
22.description: A Resolution Commending Representative Kelvin O. Buck, For His Legislative Legacy And Congratulating Him Upon His Retirement From The Mississippi House Of Representatives And Upon The Occasion Of Being Elected Mayor Of Holly Springs, Mississippi.

23.title: Representative Billy Broomfield; commend legislative service and congratulate upon his retirement.
23.description: A Resolution Commending Representative Billy Broomfield Upon His Distinguished Service As A Member Of The House Of Representatives.

24.title: Nanih Waiya Attendance Center Lady Warriors Fast-Pitch Softball Team; congratulate upon winning MHSAA Class 1A State Championship.
24.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Nanih Waiya Attendance Center Lady Warriors Fast-pitch Softball Team For Its Outstanding 2012-2013 Season And For Winning The State Championship.

25.title: MS Veterans; honor and commend valiant service provided to protect the freedoms and ensure the independence of the United States.
25.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring And Commending Mississippi's Veterans For Their Valiant Service Provided To Protect The Freedoms And Ensure The Independence Of The United States Of America.

26.title: "National Day of the Cowboy"; designate the 4th Saturday in July of each year as.
26.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating The 4th Saturday In July Of Each Year As "national Day Of The Cowboy".

27.title: Magnolia Heights Chiefs Baseball; commend team and coach for winning 2013 Academy AAA, Div. II state title.
27.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Magnolia Heights School Chiefs Baseball Team For Their Outstanding 2013 Season And For Winning The Academy Aaa, Division Ii Championship And Commending And Congratulating Head Coach Chris Mcminn On Being Selected As The Clarion-ledger's Coach Of The Year.

28.title: 2013 Second Extraordinary Session; set date for Sine Die adjournment.
28.description: A Concurrent Resolution Setting The Date Of Sine Die Adjournment Of The 2013 Second Extraordinary Session Of The Legislature.

30.title: Mayor Andre' DeBerry; commend for his many years of service as mayor of Holly Springs.
30.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Mayor Andre' Deberry On His Many Years Of Service As Mayor Of Holly Springs, Mississippi.

31.title: Commend distinguished service of Barbara Wellborn to the Mississippi Senate.
31.description: A Resolution Commending Barbara Allison Wellborn For Her Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

32.title: Commend distinguished service of Margaret Chambliss to the Mississippi Senate.
32.description: A Resolution Commending Margaret Chambliss For Her Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

33.title: Recognize Bishop Ronnie C. Crudup and Jacqueline Crudup.
33.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Extending Birthday Greetings To Bishop Ronnie C. Crudup And Jacqueline Crudup For 35 Years Of Faithful Ministry And Leadership At The New Horizon Church International Honor Celebration.

34.title: Commend North Mississippi Health Services for national award.
34.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending North Mississippi Health Services For Receiving The 2012 Malcolm Baldrige National Quality Award.

35.title: Recognize civic contributions of Holly Springs Alderman Garrie Colhoun.
35.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Civic Contributions Of Holly Springs Five-term Alderman Garrie Colhoun On The Occasion Of His Retirement.

36.title: Recognize civic contributions of former Ashland Mayor and Alderman Billy Taylor.
36.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Civic Contributions Of Former Ashland Mayor And Alderman Billy J. Taylor On The Occasion Of His Retirement.

37.title: Recognize civic contributions of Holly Springs Alderman and educator Russell Johnson.
37.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Civic Contributions Of Holly Springs Three-term Alderman And Longtime Educator Russell Johnson On The Occasion Of His Retirement.

38.title: Mourn the loss of Malaco Recording Artist Bobby "Blue" Bland.
38.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss Of Malaco Recording Artist And Rock And Roll Hall Of Fame Inductee Bobby "blue" Bland.

39.title: Recognize Gary Road School Principal Chad Shealy as the "2013 Mississippi Administrator of the Year."
39.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Gary Road Intermediate School Principal Chad Shealy As The 2013 Mississippi Administrator Of The Year.

40.title: Recognize Patti Carr Black for Lifetime Achievement Award from the Mississippi Institute of Arts and Letters.
40.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Patti Carr Black For Her Receipt Of The 2013 Noel Polk Lifetime Achievement Award From The Mississippi Institute Of Arts And Letters.

41.title: Designate 4th Saturday in July of each year as "National Day of the Cowboy."
41.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating The 4th Saturday In July Of Each Year As "national Day Of The Cowboy."

42.title: Pay tribute to service and accomplishments of Captain Viola Sanders (USN Retd.) from Greenwood, Mississippi.
42.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute To The Service And Accomplishments Of Captain Viola Sanders (usn Retd.) From Greenwood, Mississippi.

43.title: Urge United States Congress to direct Truman-Hobbs Act federal funds to replace CSX drawbridge in Hancock County.
43.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The United States Congress To Direct Truman-hobbs Act Funding To Replace The Csx Drawbridge On The Pearl River In Hancock County, Mississippi.

44.title: Urge the MS Department of Archives and History to nominate the New Capitol Building for designation as a National Historic Landmark.
44.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History To Nominate The New Capitol Building For Designation As A National Historic Landmark.

45.title: Commemorating the 50th Anniversary of the Vietnam War and designating March 29 as Vietnam Veterans Day in Mississippi.
45.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commemorating The 50th Anniversary Of The Vietnam War And Designating March 29 As An Annual Vietnam Veterans Recognition Day In Mississippi.

46.title: Congratulate 2013 Mississippi State University "Bulldogs" Baseball Team for historic season.
46.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2013 Mississippi State University "bulldogs" Baseball Team And Coach John Cohen For The Most Successful Season In Msu Baseball History.

47.title: Mourn the loss and commend the life of Gerald Ray "Gerry" Lane.
47.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Express The Sincere Condolences Of The Legislature Of Mississippi Upon The Death Of Gerald Ray Lane And Recognize His Lifetime Achievements.

48.title: Commend ECCC Warrior Baseball Team for State Championship.
48.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The East Central Community College Warrior Baseball Team For Their Outstanding 2013 Season And For Winning The Mississippi Association Of Community And Junior Colleges State Championship.

49.title: Commend the life of Mississippi Optometry Association Director Helen St. Clair.
49.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Civic And Charitable Service Of Helen St. Clair, Executive Director Of The Mississippi Optometry Association (moa) For 30 Years.

50.title: Mourn the loss of MS Department of Mental Health Executive Director Randy Hendrix.
50.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss Of Dr. Albert Randel (randy) Hendrix, Former Executive Director Of The Mississippi Department Of Mental Health, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.
